required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Different Energy Sources During TUR-P
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Two Different Bipolar and A Monopolar Energy Sources During Transurethral Resection of Prostate

brief_summary.textblock: With this study, it is aimed to compare the operative results and complication rates in transurethral resection of the prostate (TUR-P) performed by resectoscopes with two different bipolar and a monopolar energy sources.

detailed_description.textblock:
Following data will be collected and evaluated prospectively for the three groups of patients who will undergo TUR-P due to benign prostate hyperplasia (BPH) with one of the resectoscopes using different energy sources:
1. Preoperative data: age, height, weight, body-mass index, concomitant morbidities, use of any drug, history of operation, duration of lower urinary tract symptoms, history of any previous treatment taken for BPH, serum level of prostate specific antigen, prostate volume, maximum and average urine flow rate, postmicturation residual urine volume, hemoglobin level
2. Operative data: duration of operation, volume of resected tissue, observation of obturator reflex (if any), kind and size of the urethral catheter used
3. Postoperative data: time to removal of urethral catheter, hospitalization duration, change in hemoglobin, rate of blood transfusion, any other complications

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within the first 30 days after surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Determining the improvement in maximal urine flow (mL/s) and average urine flow (mL/s).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the first 30 days after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with any complications related with TURP (including hemorrhage, blood transfusion, urinary tract infections, urethral strictures) classified according to modified Clavien-Dindo classification.

arm_group.description: Transurethral resection of prostate (TURP) with bipolar resectoscope (Gyrus brand)
TURP with monopolar resectoscope (Karl Storz brand)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Having an indication due to BPH
- Aged between 40 and 80 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Kidney failure due to BPH
- Any kind of coagulopathy or use of anticoagulants in the preoperative period
- History of any previous open or endoscopic prostate surgery

overall_official.affiliation: Selcuk University, School of Medicine, Department of Urology

facility.name: Selcuk University, School of Medicine, Department of Urology
